name: invidiousness
content:
Add to word list
Add to word list
the quality of being likely to cause unhappiness or being unpleasant, especially because of being unfair: This shows the invidiousness of the court's approach. See
invidious
More examplesFewer examplesThey call him 'Piggy', but familiar use has worn off the invidiousness of the title. There is such invidiousness and corruption in the way funds are allocated.He accused us of invidiousness; that we were treating foreigners badly.
